meanings.definition: To treat or impregnate with camphor.
meanings.sent1: I camphorate my clothes to keep moths away.
meanings.sent2: The pharmacist will camphorate the ointment for better healing.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally camphorated my tea instead of sugar!
meanings.sent4: Her words seemed to camphorate the room with a calming scent.
meanings.sent5: The old book was camphorated, giving it a unique smell.

meanings.definition: To combine or mix with camphor.
meanings.sent1: She camphorates the ingredients to create a soothing balm.
meanings.sent2: The chef decided to camphorate the dish with a hint of mint.
meanings.sent3: The experiment went wrong when he accidentally camphorated the wrong chemicals.
meanings.sent4: His music camphorates different genres to create a unique sound.
meanings.sent5: The artist camphorated the colors to achieve a vibrant painting.

meanings.sent1: The process will camphorate the substance into a solid form.
meanings.sent2: The heat will camphorate the liquid into a crystalline structure.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick seemed to camphorate the coin into a tiny crystal.
meanings.sent4: The potion will camphorate the liquid, changing its properties.
meanings.sent5: The alchemist's experiment successfully camphorated the solution into a new substance.
